name: df-dmatalt
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5
body: |- wceq(cdmatalt, cmpo(s0, s1, cfn, universe, csb(s2, co(cv(s0), cmat, cv(s1)), co(cv(s2), cress, crab(s3, cfv(cbs, cv(s2)), wral(s4, cv(s0), wral(s5, cv(s0), wi(wne(cv(s4), cv(s5)), wceq(co(cv(s4), cv(s3), cv(s5)), cfv(c0g, cv(s1)))))))))))
bodyPretty: ‚ä¢ DMatALT =(s0 ‚àà Fin, s1 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶[(s0[Mat]s1)/ s2](s2[|`s]{ s3 ‚àà(Base ` s2)| ‚àÄ(s4 ‚àà s0, ‚àÄ(s5 ‚àà s0,(s4 ‚â† s5 ‚Üí(s4[s3]s5)=(0 ` s1))))}))
comment: Define the set of n x n diagonal (square) matrices over a set (usually a ring) r, see definition in [Roman] p. 4 or Definition 3.12 in [Hefferon] p. 240. (Contributed by AV, 8-Dec-2019.)
